question: Cross product ratio is used in:-
exp: Framework of a case control study (The 2 x 2 contigency table) Suspected or risk factors Cases (Disease present) Control (Disease absent) Present Absent ac bd a+c b+d Cross product ratio is another name for Odds ratio. It used to calculate strength of association between risk factor and outcome in case of case control studies. Odds Ratio (OR) = (a x d)/(b x c) Since it involves cross multiplying the values in the 2x2 Contingency table, it is called cross product ratio In coho study, Relative Risk (or Risk Ratio) is determined Cross sectional studies deal with determining prevalence of disease Ecological study is used to determine correlation

question: Interval between primary and secondary case is called as:-
exp: The gap in time between the onset of the primary case and the secondary case is called "serial interval". Incubation period: The time interval between invasion by an infectious agent and appearance of the first sign or symptom of the disease in question. Generation time: interval of time between the receipt of infection by a host and maximal infectivity of that host Lead time: it is the advantage gained by screening, i. e. the period between diagnosis by early detection and diagnosis by other means.

question: Quantitative test for same group of individuals before and after study is:-
exp: 1. Z-test for large samples 2. t-test for small samples applied as: a. Unpaired t-test (two independent samples) b. Paired t-test (single sample correlated observations) 3. ANOVA test for 3 or more samples Parametric Tests Non Parametric Tests Based on Normal distribution Non normal distribution Type of data Quantitative Qualitative Compares Means %, Propoions, Fractions Examples Paired t-test Unpaired t-test ANOVA test Sign test Chi-square test Wilcoxan test

question: What is the recommended level of chlorine in Swimming pool?
exp: Residual chloride levels in: (i. e. after the contact period of one hour) Drinking water- >/= 0. 5 mg/L or ppm Swimming pools- >/= 1. 0 mg/L To kill Cyclops in Drinking water - >/= 2. 0 mg/L Residual chlorine level can be measured using chloroscope/ Ohotoluidine test.

question: Bias in Which variation occur due to different disease treated in different hospitals:-
exp: Berkesonian bias is a special type of bias, named after Dr. Joseph Berkeson, who recognized this problem due to different rates of admission to hospitals for people with different diseases Neyman bias: due to missing of fatal cases, mild/silent cases and cases of sho duration from the study. Attention bias or Hawthorne effect: study subjects may systematically alter their behavior when they know they are being observed. Recall bias: cases are more likely to remember exposure more correctly than controls.

question: What will be the BMI of a male whose weight is 89 kg and height is 172 cms?
exp: Body Mass Index/ Quetelet's index = Weight in kg/(height)2 in m2 =89/ (1. 72)2 = 30 Nutritional status based on the WHO and "Asian Criteria" values Nutritional Status WHO criteria BMI cut - off "Asian criteria "BMI cut - off Underweight <18. 5 <18. 5 Normal 18. 5-24. 9 18. 5-22. 9 Overweight 25-29. 9 23-24. 9 Pre-Obese - 25-9. 9 Obese > 30 > 30 Obese Type 1 (obese) 30-40 30-40 Obese type type 2 (morbid obese) 40. 1-50 40. 1-50 Obese type 3 (super obese) >50 >50

question: Quantitative requirement of water in Urban areas per day:-
exp: Urban areas 150-200 litres per capita Rural areas 40 litres per capita

question: Most impoant indicator of Air pollution is:-
exp: The best indicators of air pollution are sulfur dioxide, smoke and suspended paicles. Various indicators used: Chemical: SO2, NO2, CO, Air pollution index, Soiling index, Coefficient of haze. Biological: Lichens BEST Overall- SO2

question: Endemic ascites caused by:-
exp: Endemic ascites was repoed in the Nagesia tribes of Madhya Pradesh, which presented as a rapidly developing jaundice and ascites, with over 40% moality. It occurred due to contamination of Gondhli or Panicum miliare millet by the weed seeds of Crotalaria or Jhunjhunia, which contained Pyrrolizidine alkaloids which are hepatotoxic.

question: Very low bih weight is less than:-
exp: Low bih weight (LBW)= Bih weight <2500g Very low bih weight (VLBW)= BW <1500g Extremely low bih weight (ELBW)= BW<1000g
